explanation: Agent A is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends that pointers point to const-qualified types whenever possible. In OS_FDGetInfo the pointer record is declared as OS_common_record_t * and the object obtained via the macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(&tbl[idx]) yields a non-const OS_common_record_t *. In this function the record is only read (record->name_entry, record->creator) and not modified, so the pointer can and should be declared to point to a const-qualified type (const OS_common_record_t *record) to enforce immutability at the use site. The current global declaration extern OS_common_record_t *const OS_global_stream_table makes the pointer itself const but not the pointee, so it does not provide the const qualification of the pointee that Rule 8.13 requires. Fixes include changing the local declaration to const OS_common_record_t *record (the conversion from non-const to const pointer is allowed), or if the table contents are immutably intended, changing the global declaration to extern const OS_common_record_t *const OS_global_stream_table. Either approach will address the Rule 8.13 violation.
